title.narrative: Electricity Transmission Expansion and Supply Improvement Project

description.narrative: The project will improve the reliability of energy supply in Nepal and strengthen the transmission infrastructure needed to promote Nepal's capacity for cross-border energy trade. It will provide support in three critical areas in the electricity supply industry, which has experienced severe underinvestment: (i) electricity transmission capacity expansion, (ii) strengthening of distribution systems including those along the Tamakoshi (Khimti)-Kathmandu transmission line, and (iii) rehabilitation of selected small hydropower plants.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President
Reports and Recommendations of the President
1.14 MW of additional generation capacity (or 4 gigawatt-hours of additional annual energy) provided to the system.
280 km of 220kV or 400 kV and 132 kV transmission lines added.
9,000 new households connected to the grid.
